column2: Friends Fact 101
column3: This collection stores the friends facts for the API

column2: When  Matt LeBlanc  auditioned for the role he only had 11 dollars
Before the show was cast, the main love story was intended to be between Monica and Joey
Gunther didn't have a name until the middle of the second season. Originally, he did not have a speaking part
The theme song performed by The Rembrandts became a #1 single on the American pop charts
Chandler's father's gay Las Vegas burlesque show is named Viva Las Gaygas
Other titles considered for the show were "Friends Like Us", "Six of One", "Across the Hall", and "Insomnia Cafe"
Courteney Cox is actually older than David Schwimmer, though he plays her older brother on the show
The story line of Phoebe having her brother's babies was thought up when  Lisa Kudrow  announced her real-life pregnancy
Courteney Cox  is the only regular cast member to not receive an Emmy nomination for their work on the show
The shows original theme song was "Shiny Happy People" by R.E.M., but was changed later on to "I'll Be There For You" by The Rembrandts
During the course of the series, all 6 of the friends change their jobs at least once. However, Chandler is the only one who never involuntarily left his job
Originally, Chandler and Phoebe were supporting characters
It had the most expensive commercial slot of any TV program in England with the exception of sports
The main characters from the show are named after  All My Children  (1970) characters
The orange couch used in Central Perk was found in the basement of the Warner Bros. studio
It was ranked #7 on Empire magazine's 50 Greatest TV Shows Of All Time in 2008
In the last few months of shooting Friends,  Courteney Cox  became pregnant, but it was kept hidden
Season Two is the only season of Friends where there is no episode on Thanksgiving Day
Phoebe's brother   Frank Jr.   has a small cameo in the earlier seasons
Joey's white dog statue was originally given to  Jennifer Aniston  as a good luck present from her best friend
T  owards the end of the series, every lead character was paid $1 million per episode
Everyone had the same last name in the opening credits of S06E01
Ellen DeGeneres had turned down the role of Phoebe
Bruce Willis guest starred on the show for free
Joey owes an estimated  $114,260 to Chandler in the show
There weren't really any bedrooms behind those doors at Monica's apartment. In fact, they had the Central Perk set made on the other side of the wall!
O  nly Matthew Perry (Chandler) was allowed to sit in the screen writings for the show.
June Gable, who played JoeyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s agent Estelle Leonard, also played a   nurse in the episode where Carol gives birth to Ben
When Lisa Kudrow first read the   script   , she thought Chandler's character was gay

In 1993, Matthew Perry co-wrote and pitched a sitcom to NBC about a group of twenty-somethings called Maxwell's House; the network turned it down as they already had a show in the works that was similar.
The show had many names before settling with the name Friends:- Friends Like Us, Six of One, Across the Hall, Once Upon a Time in the West Village and Insomnia Cafe.
"Shiny Happy People" by REM was the original choice for the Theme Song for the show and was used in the pilot when the show was still called Friends Like Us.
The Producers David Crane and Marta Kauffman co-wrote "I'll be there for you" with Phil Solem and Danny Wilde of the Rembrandts. Used for the theme song for all ten series.
In 1995, the song reached number 1 in the Billboard Hot 100 Airplay chart for eight weeks.
Phoebe and Chandler were originally intended to be written as supporting characters.
Monica and Joey originally intended as the main couple.
In early development, writers considered making Chandler gay.
When Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox first read their scripts they thought Chandler was gay.
When the show premiÃƒÂ¨red Matthew Perry and Jennifer Aniston were 25, Matt LeBlanc and David Schwimmer were 27, Courteney was 30 and Lisa Kudrow was 31.
The frame around the peephole in Monica's apartment was initially a mirror but was broken accidentally by a crew member but they agreed it looked better that way and kept it.
The apartments were initially 4 and 5 however the producers realised that it corresponded with the apartments being on the lower floors and changed it to 19 and 20.
The Orange couch in Central Perk was found in the basement of the Warner Bros Studios.

The couch was almost always free for the six friends because it was reserved; there was always a reservation sign on the coffee table. Except from when Ross and Chandler were bullied and Chandler's hat was taken. Fans questioned why it was always available to the gang; it was later added in an episode where they say it was permanently reserved for them.

We only find out four of their middle names throughout the seasons; Chandler Muriel Bing, Rachel Karen Green, Ross Eustace Geller and Joseph Francis Tribbiani Jr. We do however know Monica's middle name begins with an 'E' and Phoebe has a middle name but couldn't find out because Ursula sold her birth certificate.
Season 2 didn't air a Thanksgiving episode.
Ellen DeGeneres turned down the role of Phoebe.
Christina Applegate was cast as Amy Green (season 9 Thanksgiving episode) when Reese Witherspoon was unavailable to reprise her role as Jill.

Three cast members of the Simpsons made guest appearances; Dan Casellaneta (Homer) as the Zoo Keeper, Hank Azaria (Moe/Apu) as David the scientist and Harry Shearer (Mr Burns/Smithers) as Dr. Baldhara.
Hank Azaria auditioned for the role of Joey twice.
Jennifer Aniston later stated that she hated the now-iconic "Rachel" haircut.
Courteney Cox was the only one to never get nominated for an Emmy on the show.

Bruce Willis guest starred on Friends for free after losing a bet with his co-star Matthew Perry on a Whole Nine Yards that it would reach number one in the box office on the opening weekend. He was already scheduled to appear on the show then donated the money he earned from Friends to charity.
James Michael Tyler was the only extra to gain a regular part because he knew how to work the espresso machine.
James Michael Tyler was working in Hollywood coffee shop when he got the role of Gunther.
Gunther had no name until the middle of season 2.
Gunther got his first line in the 33rd episode; he said "yeah".
Ben Geller was played for four boys; Michael Gunderson as an infant; twins Thomas and John Christopher Allen during Seasons 3-5; and Cole Sprouse during Seasons 6-8.
Marcel the monkey was played by two monkeys; Katie and Monkey.
Crew Member Paul Swain was responsible for the Magna Doodles on the door of Chandler's Apartment for each episode shot there.
NBC originally thought that the cast was too young and asked writers to include an older character to give advice.
NBC also thought that Central Perk was too trendy and wanted to set the show in a diner, like Seinfeld.
Producers initially wanted Courteney Cox to play Rachel; however she felt she was more like Monica.
Erica and Jack (Monica and Chandler's twins) were born 3 minutes and 46 seconds apart.

Like Monica and Chandler; Courteney and David (her husband) found it hard to conceive in real life. However, in the last season Courteney is seen wearing baggy clothes and scarves to hide her pregnancy.
The scene with Rachel having Emma was filmed not long after Courteney had a miscarriage.
Ross was 29 for 3 years. In one season he even had two birthdays.
David Schwimmer directed 10 episodes of Friends.
David Schwimmer was also the first to be cast; it was later revealed that the writers had written the character of Ross with intentions of David Schwimmer playing the part.
Jennifer Aniston was the last to be cast.
When in London and Monica is seen to pop up from underneath Chandler's bedsheet, they had been held in position for 27 seconds.
All six cast members have kissed one another except from Monica and Phoebe.
Joey wasn't written as a dim character; Matt LeBlac suggested it.
Matt LeBlanc started going grey in his twenties and had to have his hair dyed throughout the series.
Malcom (Ursula's stalker and later Phoebe's boyfriend); portrayed by David Arquette, at that point Courteney Cox's future husband.
Yasmine Bleeth and Julia Roberts were fantasizes of Chandler's in the show; and in real like Matthew Perry had dated both of them.
"The One Where No One's Ready" was filmed entirely in Monica's apartment as after having guest stars the show didn't have a large enough budget for additional sets.
Lisa Kudrow was actually afraid of the duck.
No live audiences were used when they were filming cliff hangers.
Before the pilot aired, the cast were taken to Caeser's Palace in Las Vegas to enjoy their "last shot at anonymity". They later returned to film at this location for Ross and Rachel's wedding.
In the opening credits of "The One After Vegas", everyone had Arquette added to their last name; to commemorate the marriage of Courteney and David.
Remarkably none of Phoebe's relatives attended her and Mike's outdoor wedding.
Ross and Rachel's romance were not meant to be the central to the show; however, the storyline was developed after the chemistry David and Jennifer had on screen.
Courteney Cox is older than David Schwimmer in real life, despite playing his younger sister on screen.
The fridge in Monica's apartment was fully functional and was always stocked with drinks for the cast and crew.
Matthew Perry told the producers that he was awkward with women; there the writers wrote his character Chandler that way.
Phoebe's triplets were written into the show because Lisa Kudrow was pregnant in real life and the writers needed to have a way of incorporating the pregnancy and not having a child amidst the group.

In the pilot Monica forgets the name of the guy she sleeps with, worried the audience would not like her character; the handed out a survey to the studio audience and asked if they wanted the plot to change. They didn't.
Although the TV show sold millions of different types of merchandise; they only produced two soundtracks.
Before filming each episode; the cast would huddle round wishing each other luck.
The final episode was watched by 52.46 million viewers and is ranked fourth most watch TV finale in US History.
On average, each episode took five hours to film.

In the first season each cast member were being paid $22,500 per episode; in 1997 the group together negotiated with the show and got $100,000 per episode (it was the first time in TV history); and by the end of the series they were each paid $1 million per episode.
Kathy was the second woman to date both Joey and Chandler; Ginger was the first.
Janice came up with her catchphrase "oh my God" accidentally and had to say it annoyingly throughout her guest appearances.
Lisa Kudrow made a guest appearance on Mad About You as Ursula Buffay before friends; the writers had to make Phoebe a twin in order for fans to understand the crossover and cameos.
Winona Ryder and Susan Saradon were both on Ross's "celebrity list"; they both later guest starred as Melissa Warburton and Jessica Lockhart.
In the last episode the gang said that at one point or another they had all lived in Monica's apartment; they have also all lived in Chandler's.
During Season 1, the street outside of Central Perk was actually a painted backdrop.
The artwork within Central Perk always changed.
Frank Jr, portrayed by Giovanni Ribisi; was Phoebe's younger half brother; he was also the young man who mistakenly dropped a condom in her guitar case whilst she was busking outside of Central Perk.

When Chandler and Monica were getting married, Rachel needed to find a new officiate because they didn't think Joey would make it. She found a Greek Orthodox Priest and said it was for her friends the Anastassakis/Papasifakis wedding. Anastassakis is in fact Jennifer Aniston's family name.
In the episode "The One With The Dollhouse"; six replica dollhouses were made as the plot would mean it would be set alight.
The door to the secret closet within Monica's apartment actually led to the area backstage and had to be covered with things when Chandler managed to get in to see.
Monica, Rachel, Joey and Chandler live in flats 19 and 20, 90 Bedford Street, New York.
The set designer Greg Grande also worked on the spin off series Joey.
The ceiling beam in Monica's apartment that inconsistently appears in episodes gets reinstalled whenever James Burrows directed an episode as part of an inside joke.
The movie poster behind the TV in Monica's apartment was put there to hide the hole where the camera's would film.
Although the series is based in New York City, not a single shot was filmed there.
Matt LeBlanc had $11 to his name when he auditioned, with his first pay check he bought a hot meal; the first thing Courteney Cox bought was a car.
The big white dog in Chandler's apartment reportedly said by Courteney Cox that it beonged to her husband David Arquette.
However, it is said to have belonged to Jennifer Aniston, it was supposedly given to her a gift before the series started as a good luck present.

It's no surprise that there are contradictions within the plot; like "The One Where Chandler Doesn't Like Dogs", but yet he and Monica discuss a future family with a dog; and Ross states he doesn't like ice cream but we have seen him enjoying one with Elizabeth and one with Marcel.
June Gable who plays Joey's agent Estelle Leonard also plays a nurse in the episode when Carol has Ben.
The actor that plays Rachel's boyfriend Joshua's father is Matthew Perry's real like father John B. Perry.
Phoebe's address is Apartment 14, 5 Morton Street, New York
The show received a lot of heat for having Pottery Barn product placement in "The One With The Apothecary Table".
Peter Roth of Warner Bros once said it "offset the high cost of production" and a rep reported "the phones still light up every time the episode airs".
In the final season when Rachel visits her father, the exterior of the house was the same as the one made famous by the Steve Martin movie "Planes, Trains and Automobiles".
The doors to the bedrooms in Monica's apartment actually took you onto the set of Central Perk. The bedrooms were made up when they were needed for a scene.
"The One After The Superbowl" aired in 1996, it is ranked the highest viewer ratings.
Jon Faveau turned down the role of Chandler; however portrayed Pete, one of Monica's boyfriends.
Jon Cryer also auditioned for Chandler.
The opening credits was actually filmed at Warner Bros Studios; not at Gramercy Park or Central Park.
Lisa Kudrow hated playing the guitar at first.
Kathy Griffin and Jane Lynch both auditioned for Phoebe.
Tom Selleck who played Richard Burke, would often get very loud applauds from the live studio audience and the producers would have to re-shoot the scene without the audience watching.
Some of the laughter from the show's live audience was cut in scenes so the next punch line wasn't lost.
When the series ended Jennifer Aniston and her then husband Brad Pitt hosted a dinner party. They served bottles of wine the producer Kevin Bright had saved from the first series.
Each cast member was also given a piece of side walk from outside Central Perk as a keepsake.
It wasnâ€™t always called Friends.
column3: The showâ€™s working titles were Insomnia CafÃ©, Friends Like Us, and Six of One, before everyone settled on Friends.

column2: The credits werenâ€™t shot in New York.
column3: The opening was shot at Warner Bros. Studios in California. Thereâ€™s a reason youâ€™ve never been able to find the fountain on the East Coast.

column2: No one was a real fan of the theme song.
column3: According to Jennifer Aniston, â€œWe felt it was a littleâ€¦I donâ€™t knowâ€¦dancing in a pond? A fountain felt sort of odd.â€ She says the only reason they did it because they â€œwere told to.â€

column2: Before the pilot aired, the cast went to Las Vegas.
column3: They dined at Spago inside Caesarâ€™s Palace to enjoy their â€œlast shot at anonymity.â€ The cast would return some six years later to shoot Mr. Rachelâ€™s wedding to Mrs. Ross (and Joeyâ€™s movie fail, among other things).

column2: Courteney Cox was just like Monica IRL.
column3: In 1995, show cocreator Marta Kauffman told the Los Angeles Times that Cox had â€œthe neatestâ€ dressing room. In the same interview, Cox said, â€œOkay, I am a neat freak. Not about myself. I donâ€™t use a lint brush or anything and I donâ€™t iron, but I could easily pick lint off of someone else.â€ To quote Ross, â€œMONICAAA!â€

column2: Friends was supposed to have just four friends.
column3: Phoebe and Chandler were originally written as supporting roles. Can you even imagine?

column2: Monica and Joey were supposed to get together.
column3: According to Kauffman, the studio audienceâ€™s response to Monica and Chandler first getting together was so overwhelming, the show went in â€œa different direction.â€

column2: The names of all six Friends were inspired by characters from All My Children.
column3: Chandler is for the Chandler family, Rachelâ€™s last name is for Janet Green, Ross is for Ross Chandler (LOL), Monica is for Monique (Daisy Cortland), Joey is for Joseph â€œJoeyâ€ Martin, and Phoebe is for Phoebe Tyler Wallingford.

column2: David Schwimmer didnâ€™t have to audition for Ross.
column3: As Kauffman explained in 2012, â€œSchwimmer had auditioned the year before for a pilot we were making, and he just stuck in our heads. That was an offer. No audition.â€

column2: Phoebe was supposed to be goth.
column3: Phoebe was originally pitched as a â€œgoth girl,â€ which prompted Janeane Garofalo to turn down the role. â€œThere is some truth to it, but not exactly that,â€ she later explained. â€œLong ago before Friends was Friends, when it was in its infancy, it was a show called Friends Like Us, and I was being considered for a role, like a goth girl, which I think morphed into Phoebe.â€

column2: Gunther was a barista IRL.
column3: â€œI had a job at a coffee shop called The Bourgeois Pig in Hollywood, which is still around and one of the last independent coffee shops that hasnâ€™t been taken over or whatnot," James Michael Tyler told BuzzFeed in 2014. â€œI was one of their first baristasâ€”I think I started there in 1990 or so.â€

column2: Hank Azaria auditioned for the role of Joey.
column3: Twice. Itâ€™s okay. He was destined to play David and go to Minsk for a really long time. (Maybe too long.)

column2: Jane Lynch auditioned for Phoebe.
column3: So did Kathy Griffin. Obviously, weâ€™re going to need to see those tapes now. (Jane eventually did appear on the show as a real estate agent in the final season.)

column2: The identity of the actor who played Ugly Naked Guy wasnâ€™t revealed until 2016.
column3: Thanks to a Huffington Post investigation. Memorize this name for your next trivia night: Jon Haugen. We applaud you.

column2: Paul Rudd got the role of Mike after a casting director wrote â€œdreamyâ€ in her notes.
column3: According to Leslie Litt, â€œWe had a casting session for that role, but no one was quite it. Paul agreed to do a one-time meet and read with Lisa [Kudrow]. All I wrote on my notes was â€˜dreamyâ€™!â€

column2: There was an intervention for Jennifer Anistonâ€™s tardiness.
column3: â€œDavid did it. Very kindly,â€ Aniston later told Us Weekly. â€œThe day my alarm didnâ€™t ring.â€

column2: Thereâ€™s a reason â€œThe One Where No Oneâ€™s Readyâ€ takes place entirely in Monicaâ€™s apartment.
column3: Showrunners used a â€œbottle episodeâ€ format for this season 3 favorite due to budget restrictions, as it was later revealed in the 2005 special, Friends: Final Thoughts.

column2: Lisa Kudrow hated the guitar at first.
column3: In fact, she suggested that Phoebe play the bongos instead. (Thankfully, the guitar stuck.)

column2: Bruce Willis guest starred on the show after losing a bet.
column3: The bet was with Matthew Perry, his costar in The Whole Nine Yards (2000). Rumor has it that Bruce donated his money to charity. Either way, he will always be the neatest guy.

column2: Monica is actually older than Ross IRL.
column3: Courteney Cox is two years older than David Schwimmer, despite playing his little sister.

column2: The orange sofa in Central Perk was found in the basement of Warner Bros. Studios.
column3: You know what they say about one manâ€™s trash becoming one of the most famous couches on TV.â€¦

column2: Monica's apartment number changed from 5 to 20.
column3: (Top photo: season 1; bottom photo: season 10) The change was made after the writers realized an apartment with the number 5 did not denote a unit on a higher floor in New York City. Chandler and Joeyâ€™s apartment also changed from 4 to 19.

column2: Phoebe is actually not swearing while playing Ms. Pac-Man.
column3: â€œOh! I donâ€™t know if I was allowed to actually swear,â€ Lisa Kudrow revealed in a Reddit AMA. â€œWe pre-shot that part, and I think I remember Kevin Bright, our executive producer, laughing and saying, â€˜I know, but no one should even be able to read it on your lips.â€™â€

column2: Ross lied about not liking ice cream.
column3: Before he enjoyed a sweet treat with Elizabeth (â€œThe One Where Ross Dates a Studentâ€), Ross had ice cream with Marcel (â€œThe One After the Superbowlâ€). Doesnâ€™t look like your teeth are hurting in both cases, Ross.

column2: For a long time, Friends was not allowed to show even a condom wrapper during the 8 p.m. slot.
column3: As cocreator David Crane told Vanity Fair in 2012, â€œThe rules kept changing. For the first three years, we could say â€˜penis.â€™ Then we couldnâ€™t say â€˜penis.â€™ Then we could say â€˜penisâ€™ again.â€ Added Kauffman: â€œTheyâ€™re masturbating on Seinfeld and we canâ€™t show a condom wrapper.â€ Warren Littlefield, then the president of NBC Entertainment, said he had a lot of battles with broadcast standards. â€œWhat could be more socially responsible than these characters practicing safe sex?â€

column2: The big white dog actually belonged to Jennifer Aniston.
column3: â€œPat the dogâ€ was given to Aniston by a friend for good luck on the first day of shooting Friends.

column2: Lisa Kudrowâ€™s pregnancy was written into the show.
column3: â€œHereâ€™s what was difficult about having a child: When he visited the set, it was hard to be in character,â€ Kudrow later said. â€œBecause I didnâ€™t want him to ever experience me as anything OTHER than his mother.â€

column2: Cole Sprouse (Ben) had a huge crush on Jennifer Aniston.
column3: â€œI had a really, really hard time working with Aniston because I was so in love with her,â€ he told the New York Post in 2017. â€œI was infatuated. I was speechlessâ€”Iâ€™d get all bubbly and forget my lines and completely blankâ€¦It was so difficult.â€

column2: Matt LeBlancâ€™s offscreen shoulder injury was written into the episode.
column3: â€œYeah, but get this,â€ he later told Glamour. â€œThe audience was full of Diet Coke contest winners flown in from all over the country, and I did two scenes, popped my shoulder, and they had to cancel it. So they all got flown home and then flown back for another week. So it cost Coca-Cola a lot more than they anticipated. What are you going to do?â€

column2: Marcel was actually played by two monkeys, Monkey and Katie.
column3: The pair would go on to star in Bruce Almighty, 30 Rock, and other things. In 1995, Schwimmer told Entertainment Weekly that he actually hated the monkey. â€œThe trainers wonâ€™t let me bond with it. Theyâ€™re really, really possessive. Itâ€™s like, â€˜Land on your marks, do your job, donâ€™t touch or bond with the monkey.â€™ It's a bummer.â€ AGREED.

column2: Everyoneâ€™s last name in the opening for â€œThe One After Vegasâ€ included â€œArquette.â€
column3: They were celebrating then-newlyweds Courteney Cox Arquette and David Arquette, who were married from 1999 to 2013.

column2: Matthew Perryâ€™s dad made a cameo in season 4.
column3: John Bennett Perry played Joshuaâ€™s dad in â€œThe One with Rachelâ€™s New Dress.â€

column2: Before he was Frank Jr., Giovanni Ribisi had an uncredited role as "Condom Boy" in season 2.
column3: Condom boy, you know, the one who accidentally throws a condom into Phoebeâ€™s guitar case. His days as Frank Jr. were much better.

column2: When Joey and Rachel got together, the cast went to the creators with concerns.
column3: As Matt LeBlanc said in a 2012 Vanity Fair feature, â€œIt felt wildly inappropriate. Thatâ€™s how close we all were to the character. I was like, â€˜Thatâ€™s Rachel. She was supposed to be with Ross. Wait a minute.â€™ Everybody got super-defensive about the whole thing.â€

column2: Courteney Cox is the only Friend to not receive an Emmy nod for her work on the show.
column3: Even Christina Pickles, who played Monicaâ€™s mom Judy, got a nomination for her guest role one year. Guess the Emmys had no love for Monicaâ€™s tidiness, wit, and that incredible â€œ7â€ scene.

column2: Ross is 29 for three years.
column3: For three consecutive seasons (3, 4, 5), Ross mentions that heâ€™s 29. (In season 5, he actually says heâ€™s getting divorced twice before heâ€™s 30.) Naturally, Ross also has two birthdays on Friends: Oct. 18 and some time in December. Ross can indeed.

column2: Cliffhangers were never shot with a live studio audience.
column3: The season 4 finale, â€œThe One With Rossâ€™s Wedding," where Ross says, â€œI take thee Rachel,â€ is a prime example. â€œWe couldnâ€™t have an audience for that,â€ Aniston said in the 2005 Friends: Final Thoughts special. â€œWe always remove the audience for the cliffhangers because, obvious reasons, you donâ€™t want to spoil it.â€

column2: Jon Favreau (Pete) originally auditioned for Chandler.
column3: But donâ€™t worry, Favreau's still got a soft spot for Pete after all these years. â€œPete Becker was a man of tremendous focus and conviction. He set his heart to being the Ultimate Fighting Champion and I have no doubt that he gave it his all. Iâ€™m only sorry that that chapter was never closed by the Friends writers because Iâ€™ll always have to live with the uncertainty of what his fate held.â€

column2: Guntherâ€™s first line came after 33 episodes, when he said, â€œYeah.â€
column3: Gunther also didnâ€™t have a name until the middle of the second season, and his hair was bleached every week for 10 years because James Michael Tylerâ€™s hair is brown IRL.

column2: Janiceâ€™s appearances were always kept secret.
column3: Explains actress Maggie Wheeler, â€œThey would keep me hiddenâ€“I could barely come down to get a doughnut. I had to stay in my dressing room until the last moment and then theyâ€™d secretly move me from behind the set to the right spot and theyâ€™d keep a black screen so the audience couldnâ€™t see me until I made my first entrance.â€

column2: â€œThe One With the Halloween Partyâ€ was the first episode they filmed after 9/11.
column3: According to Lisa Kudrow, who says itâ€™s her favorite episode of Friends ever, â€œThat whole week, while driving in L.A., people would pull up and give me a very sad look and a quiet â€˜thank youâ€™ for making them laugh.â€

column2: Justin Timberlake really wanted a cameo.
column3: According to show cocreator David Crane, there was a meeting with JT, â€œbut we didnâ€™t have a good part for him.â€

column2: Joey and Phoebe could have been a thing.
column3: In 2016, Matt LeBlanc told EW, â€œToward the end, we actually pitched the idea that Joey and Phoebe had been having casual sex the entire time. Weâ€™d go back and shoot all the historical scenes and just before a moment that everyone recognizes, thereâ€™s Joey and Phoebe coming out of a broom closet together. But they were like, â€˜Nah.â€™â€

column2: The espresso machine at Central Perk was never on because it was too loud.
column3: â€œThat was a real antique coffee machine. I never actually made one coffee!â€ James Michael Tyler (Gunther) later told BuzzFeed.

column2: The finale caused Matt LeBlanc so much anxiety, he started smoking again.
column3: â€œI had quit smoking for four years, and in that final two weeks, I started smoking again because we were so aware that our time together was coming to an end,â€ he told Vanity Fair in 2012.

column2: When the series wrapped, each cast member took home a piece of Central Perk.
column3: Specifically, pieces of the fake sidewalk outside Central Perk.

column2: Central Perk was torn down to become the airport where Rachel takes off from.
column3: But as we all know, she got off the plane, which makes the tear-down a waste, no?

column2: Jennifer Aniston almost said no to the final season.
column3: Speaking to Matt Lauer in 2004, Aniston said she had â€œa couple issuesâ€ with another season. â€œI wanted it to end when people still loved us and we were on a high. And then I was also feeling like, â€˜How much more of Rachel do I have in me?â€™â€ She eventually agreed to the final season, just as creators lowered the episode count from 24 to 18.

column2: The creators knew early on that Ross and Rachel would end up together.
column3: â€œWe had dicked the audience around for 10 years with their â€˜will they or wonâ€™t they,â€™ and we didnâ€™t see any advantage in frustrating them,â€ according to David Crane.

column2: Long before Hollywood started tackling the pay gap between male and female actresses, everyone on 'Friends' earned the same per episode.
column3: By the end of the showâ€™s run, each Friend was earning $1 million per episode; todayâ€™s pay issues have left Lisa Kudrow â€œfuming.â€

column2: â€œShoot nightsâ€ could go as late as 1 or 2 a.m.
column3: If the audience got too tired, they would sometimes be swapped out for a â€œfreshâ€ one.

column2: Rachel was originally supposed to propose to Joshua right after Ross got engaged.
column3: When Aniston shot that scene after Rossâ€™s engagement, the live audience was so sad that writers decided to move it to the next episode so everyone could have â€œrecovery time.â€

column2: Netflix paid $80 million to keep it streaming in 2019.
column3: After the internet lost its mind when news broke that Friends would leave the streaming service in 2019, Netflix paid a reported $100 million to ensure you can watch the gang 24/7. (It left Netflix for good in January 2020.)

column2: Originally, the creators wanted Courteney Cox to play Rachel.
column3: In a 2015 interview, Aniston said that while the Friends team wanted Cox to play Rachel, the real-life BFFs had other plans: â€œUnbeknownst to each other, I wanted to play Rachel and she wanted to play Monica. It worked out perfectly.â€

column2: Original reviews of the show were mixed.
column3: Variety said that the show â€œtouts promiscuity,â€ but the New York Times still recommended tuning in.

column2: Jennifer Aniston was almost replaced.
column3: Aniston had actually already been cast in another sitcom, and NBC was still auditioning people for her role. Luckily, they couldnâ€™t find anyone else, and the other sitcom ultimately got cancelled.

column2: Matt LeBlanc almost played Phil on Modern Family.
